title: Drawing, 1788
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and gray wash, watercolor over graphite on two sheets of white laid paper joined at center laid down on blue paper with added border of blue paper.
inscribed: At lower right, in black ink:  PIAN SUPERIORE  TˆII; at lower left, scale measurement(in Venetian feet)
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli (1845-1926), Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Plan of upper floor of theatre with horseshoe shaped section at bottom of image.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1788.
1788. Pen and black ink; brush and gray wash, watercolor over graphite on two sheets of white laid paper joined at center laid down on blue paper with added border of blue paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-118.
